intro: Landolphia droogmansiana, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its long, trailing stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces large, woody fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a fibrous, fleshy aril. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests and secondary growth areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
